title: Counting Practice
description: Practice counting and identifying numbers up to 100

questions.explanation: When counting, we add 1 to get the next number. So after 45 comes 46.
When counting backwards, we subtract 1 to get the previous number. So before 30 comes 29.
When counting by tens, we add 10 each time. After 30, we add 10 to get 40.
Yes, when counting up, 99 comes right before 100.

questions.text: Match the number words to their numbers:
questions.explanation: Number words can be written as digits: twenty-five is 25, forty-two is 42, seventy-eight is 78, and ninety is 90.

questions.text: Put these numbers in order from smallest to largest:
How many tens are in the number 70?

questions.explanation: To find 10 more than a number, we add 10. So 45 + 10 = 55.

questions.text: Which group of numbers is in the correct order?
questions.explanation: The numbers 23, 32, 33, 43 are in ascending order (smallest to largest).
